meanings.sent1: The knight wore sturdy loricae into battle.
meanings.sent2: Soldiers in ancient times relied on loricae for defense.
meanings.sent3: The loricae seemed to have a mind of their own, protecting the warrior at all costs.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was her loricae, shielding her from any doubts.
meanings.sent5: The gleaming loricae shone brightly under the sun, a symbol of strength and protection.

meanings.definition: A type of Roman military armor
meanings.sent1: The loricae worn by Roman soldiers were meticulously crafted.
meanings.sent2: Historians study the design of loricae to understand ancient warfare.
meanings.sent3: The Roman legionnaire proudly displayed his loricae, a badge of honor.
meanings.sent4: The loricae stood as a testament to the Roman army's discipline and skill.
meanings.sent5: The intricate details of the loricae showcased the craftsmanship of Roman armorers.

meanings.definition: The plural form of lorica, referring to multiple protective coverings or armors.
meanings.sent1: The armory was filled with loricae of various styles and sizes.
meanings.sent2: Warriors gathered to exchange stories of their loricae from different battles.
meanings.sent3: The loricae lined up in rows, creating a formidable display of protection.
meanings.sent4: Legends spoke of heroes adorned in loricae that glowed with mystical energy.
meanings.sent5: The loricae clanked together as the soldiers marched, a symphony of strength and unity.
